We Represent Victims Of Nursing Home Dehydration And Malnutrition

Nursing homes must ensure that residents are well-nourished and that they consume sufficient fluids to remain healthy.

Understanding The Devastation Of Dehydration And Malnutrition On Seniors

Unfortunately, all too often, seniors are neglected by staff or failures in care occur and seniors become malnourished or dehydrated.

  • Dehydration — Dehydration can begin taking a toll on a senior in a relatively short time. The most likely scenario is not that a senior will have no access to fluids, but that he or she will not receive enough fluids. Living in an extended state of dehydration can have a serious impact on anyone’s health.
  • Malnutrition — Not receiving enough nutrition will not have as dramatic an impact as dehydration, so it can be harder to detect.

The effects of dehydration and malnutrition are made worse by other medical conditions. For example, if your senior loved one is diabetic, malnutrition and dehydration can have a major, even fatal, impact.

Even for those not suffering from other health conditions, dehydration and malnutrition can create harmful chemical imbalances.

Protecting The Rights Of The Injured Since 1968

At Lamkin, Van Eman, Trimble & Dougherty, LLC, our attorneys are committed to offering real help to our clients whose senior loved ones have been harmed in a nursing home.

We are skilled at what we do, having helped those all throughout Columbus, Ohio, since 1968. We will investigate and uncover evidence required to build a strong case against the nursing home and any other responsible parties.

Using Decades Of Legal Experience To Help You Recover

If your loved one suffered injuries due to dehydration or malnutrition, we will use our 100-plus years of combined experience to obtain maximum compensation for you and your loved one.

Contact Our Team Today To Set Up A Free Consultation

When a loved one has suffered malnutrition or dehydration in a nursing home, you need to know that your lawyer will offer the best chance of truly helping that loved one.

If you need legal assistance for an injured loved one in a nursing home, turn to our skilled and experienced personal injury attorneys.

Call 614-360-2706 or simply contact us online. We offer free consultations and collect attorneys’ fees only if we recover compensation for you.
